title: Thunderbird Document (.eml) in local network
creator: KSIEGOWOSC9
content:
Hello, For some time now (maybe since the last update), I haven't been able to open an eml file saved on another disk in the local network. These are important messages saved by various network users. I can open these documents with another email program. 

My actions: I added the Thunderbird program to the Windows firewall exceptions. I turned off the firewall. I disabled the antivirus program. I uninstalled the program and reinstalled it. Nothing worked.  A colleague can open these files, but she has version 128.11.1esr - which I cannot install without creating a new profile. At the moment I have 4 profiles, so it would be problematic, especially since I don't know for how long it would help.

Please help. Best regards. Nina tel. +48604630860, ksiegowosc@cdpartner.pl

PS. I have two e-mail accounts with long history of messeging. Last summer the Thunderbird started to hang. I divided my 1 profile into 4 - two active and two archives. Now they are working.

title: Inbox toegankelijkheid
creator: leo2
content: Ik gebruik Thunderbird 128.11.1esr (64bits) onder W11 Home versie 24H2 build 26100.4349. Ik heb drie email accounts in gesteld. De twee daarvan doen het nog als vanouds. De derde kan sinds gisteren (24 juni 2025) de ontvangen email niet meer kwijt in de Inbox. Na de melding van zoveel berichten ontvangen verschijnt er een pop-up waarin zoveel staat als "onvoldoende opslagruimte of geen toegangsrechten". Zie bijgevoegd screenshot. Er is geen sprake van te weinig geheugen of een enorme inbox. Heb voor de zekerheid drastisch opgeschoond maar dat hielp niet. Het probleem is zomaar midden op de dag ontstaan zonder voor mij duidelijke aanleiding. Ik heb geprobeerd om iets te doen aan toegangsrechten maar daar kom ik niet uit. Boven dien hebben de twee andere accounts geen probleem.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:139.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/139.0

title: Unsaved email addresses turning up in autocomplete
creator: unrealjayhumphrey
content:
This question is now over 10 years old: In the auto-complete of e-mail addresses, old invalid addresses keep appearing in this list that are not in any address book (any more). How can I delete one from the list, or perhaps all?

It's not mine, and I'm pretty sure the bug is far older than this. You send one email to a person and afterwards their email keeps popping up in suggestions even though you didn't save it in collected addresses.

The only solution offered is an extremely clunky, labour-intensive workaround. It's not the users' fault. When is this absolutely-not-a-feature getting the attention it deserves? The option Collected addresses should not work if it's not selected.

Yours in annoyance on a hot and sticky day.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/134.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 OPR/119.0.0.0;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/blocking-sender"]

title: Emails sent to me but not received
creator: maggiemason
content:
Last weekend I had to verify a third party account via my Thunderbird email address. I tried six times and didn't receive an email. This was ridiculous. It had never happened previously. I double checked my back up Gmail account and the emails weren't there either which clearly demonstrated that I hadn't received them.

I spoke to the company today who could only keep reiterating that they'd been sent and they could "see" they had been received. The fact that nothing appeared in my Gmail account either meant nothing and the fact that this had never happened with Thunderbird previously also meant nothing. I was told in no uncertain terms that the problem was at my end.

The most annoying part is that for every other thing they use my Thunderbird email address without any problem so having been told that the problem was my end they had no answer as to why some emails arrived and some did not.

I was asked to contact Support to see if for some reason they'd been blocked.

Advice would be much appreciated.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/115.0

title: T'bird now sends emails from a different account.
creator: simoncharlestomsett

title: Calendar - linking to Google
creator: rick_hughes
content:
I use Thunderbird as main email client on PC, I also access via iPAD email

On iPAD if I get a Calendar invite (eg Teams) I can scroll to bottom of the invite, and there is an option to add ICS file to Calendar. I click on it and it pushes the invite to Google Calendar, and it inserts the correct appointment.

However on my main device (W11 PC) Thunderbird does not show any ICS file. There is a banner that say "This message contains event information. Enable a Calendar to Handle it" Can it be configured to use Google Calendar as the linked Calendar ? If so, could someone explain to me how to do this.

title: Current Thunderbird under Linux Mint 22.1 SMTP password issue
creator: dlj1685
content:
I recently became the webmaster for our local American Legion post and built a website through Hostinger. That service also offered a cost-effective email solution for us and I've created a number of email accounts for our office positions and some individuals by name. At the level of service we have with Hostinger, our website/email account domain is not the same as the email servers.

That's ordinarily not a problem, since most modern email applications can either pull domain email hostnames from registration records or gives the user a manual process to enter the email hostnames directly (in our case an IMAP and SMTP hostname belonging to Hostinger).

I had no problem using the manual configuration that Thunderbird supports to set up my first American Legion email address. Email was received immediately and testing outgoing email worked fine. Adding a second American Legion email address seemed to go well - email messages came in immediately - but the outbound testing failed with error messages that the sending client was not recognized.

That sounded like Thunderbird was not trying to authenticate with a password on the SMTP outbound even though I had indicated in the manual setup that a password was required (same as I had in the first American Legion account setup).

I checked the Thunderbird settings to see what saved passwords were recorded in the Password Manager and sure enough their were three IMAP host passwords but only two SMTP host passwords (the missing SMTP host password was for the second American Legion account).

I completely deleted the second American Legion account and tried again - just in case I had accidentally indicated no password needed for SMTP the first time - and got the same result (IMAP host password created, but not SMTP). I then tried deleting both American Legion accounts and then adding them back with the second account being added first this time. At least the problem was consistent - the first account added had both an IMAP host password record and a SMTP host password created; the second account created had only its IMAP host password saved.

I couldn't find a menu item for adding a host password in the Save Passwords settings menu; manually removing the IMAP password to force the system to ask for the password again only ended up with the IMAP host password being added back into the TBird Password Manager.

The version Linux Mint reports for Thunderbird is 1:128.11.1esr+linuxmint1+xia. As far as I can tell the issue only comes up when Thunderbird cannot auto-detect the email servers on its own and it only has a problem when more than one email account has to be added for a manually configured email domain.

Is there a TBird menu item I'm missing that would let me add the SMTP host password for the second account manually? Failing that, is this a known issue that has already been fixed by Thunderbird and should be forthcoming after that version is released as an update by the Linux Mint team?
metadata: ;solver_id:3903007;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:139.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/139.0

title: Erro no thunderbird

Message:

Hello Thunderbird Support Team,

I'm experiencing a serious and blocking issue with Thunderbird after attempting to import a backup of my emails.

Whenever I try to create a subfolder under the "Inbox", I receive the following error:

swift Copiar c√≥digo Error: An unexpected error occurred Failed to create subfolder: Inbox normalizeError@resource://gre/modules/ExtensionCommon.sys.mjs:875:12 wrapPromise/</<@resource://gre/modules/ExtensionCommon.sys.mjs:1025:23 This issue is preventing any proper folder management or import activity. It appears to be related to the newer Thunderbird builds (possibly version 128.x), and I suspect it may be linked to spam/junk folder configurations or internal handling of folder URIs. </p>

This is highly disruptive for daily operations, and I urgently need a fix or workaround.

Could you please advise on how to resolve this, or confirm if this is a known issue that will be addressed in an upcoming update?

Looking forward to your prompt help.

Thanks in advance, ALEX FORTUNATO
